Question 1.question: Which of the following is an example of Non-Functional Requirement?
Question 1.answer_a: The bank customer must be able to withdraw cash from the ATM
Question 1.answer_b: The system must be able to use WiFi to communicate all transactions with a clients secure database
Question 1.answer_c: The customer must be able to load the webpage within 3 seconds
Question 1.answer_d: The system must display the current time in 24 hour format

Question 2.question: Which of the following is true about <<include>> in the Use Case Diagram
Question 2.answer_a: It helps to add more functionality to another use case
Question 2.answer_b: It is only used in parent Use Case in exceptional or unusual circumstances
Question 2.answer_c: It supports the reuse of functionality in a Use Case model
Question 2.answer_d: The included use case is usually optional

Question 3.question: Which of the following is NOT the main reason why project team review clients specification?
Question 3.answer_a: To identify the actors in the Use Case
Question 3.answer_b: To initiate the generation of Data Dictionary
Question 3.answer_c: To ensure that the design of the system can be completed on schedule
Question 3.answer_d: To identify uncertainties and clarify with client
